name: Mango pancakes
description: Recipe video above. Everybody's favourite at yum cha! Forget the long weekend queues, make them yourself. It's 75% cheaper and they taste exactly like the real thing.If this is your first time, allow for some crepe-learning causalities (hence I say 9 - 12 pancakes). Even better, just double the batter so you have plenty to practice with and eat leftovers for breakfast!
recipeIngredient: 2  large ripe mangoes (, skin peeled with a knife, cut into 10 to 12 pieces (7 x 2.5 x 1 cm, 3 x 1 x 1/2"))
3 tbsp icing sugar / powdered sugar (, sifted)

itemListElement.text: Batter - Place the milk in a bowl. Sift the flour, cornflour and icing sugar in then whisk until lump free. Add eggs and food colouring, whisk until combined. It will be a very thin, watery batter.
itemListElement.name: Batter - Place the milk in a bowl. Sift the flour, cornflour and icing sugar in then whisk until lump free. Add eggs and food colouring, whisk until combined. It will be a very thin, watery batter.

itemListElement.text: Measure batter - Give the batter a mix (to stir in flour settled at bottom) then measure out 45 ml (3 tbsp) of crepe batter.
itemListElement.name: Measure batter - Give the batter a mix (to stir in flour settled at bottom) then measure out 45 ml (3 tbsp) of crepe batter.

itemListElement.text: Non-stick pan - Use a 18cm/7" non-stick pan (Note 4). Spray lightly with oil then heat over a medium low stove.
itemListElement.name: Non-stick pan - Use a 18cm/7" non-stick pan (Note 4). Spray lightly with oil then heat over a medium low stove.

itemListElement.text: Cook pancake - Pour the batter into the middle - it should sizzle very lightly - then swirl to cover the base in a thin layer. Cook for 45 seconds to 1 minute or until the middle is set to touch. About halfway through cooking, start loosening the edges with a rubber spatula to ensure it flips out easily.
itemListElement.name: Cook pancake - Pour the batter into the middle - it should sizzle very lightly - then swirl to cover the base in a thin layer. Cook for 45 seconds to 1 minute or until the middle is set to touch. About halfway through cooking, start loosening the edges with a rubber spatula to ensure it flips out easily.

itemListElement.text: Flip the crepe out upside down onto a large cutting board. GOAL: Surface is set, underside has no golden patches. (Note 5) Adjust heat as needed.
itemListElement.name: Flip the crepe out upside down onto a large cutting board. GOAL: Surface is set, underside has no golden patches. (Note 5) Adjust heat as needed.

itemListElement.text: Cook more! Spray pan with oil then continue cooking the pancakes. You can flip them out on top of each other.
itemListElement.name: Cook more! Spray pan with oil then continue cooking the pancakes. You can flip them out on top of each other.

itemListElement.text: Cool - Full cool the crepes for 1 hour before using.
itemListElement.name: Cool - Full cool the crepes for 1 hour before using.

itemListElement.text: Cream - Just before assembling, place the cream, icing sugar and vanilla in a cold bowl and beat until stiff (about 2 minutes on speed 8 of a 10 speed hand mixer).
itemListElement.name: Cream - Just before assembling, place the cream, icing sugar and vanilla in a cold bowl and beat until stiff (about 2 minutes on speed 8 of a 10 speed hand mixer).

itemListElement.text: Filling - Place a crepe on a work surface so the side that was in contact with the pan is facing up. (Note 6) Spread 1cm/1/3" thick layer of cream one-third of the way up the pancake, in the shape of a piece of mango. Top with mango.
itemListElement.name: Filling - Place a crepe on a work surface so the side that was in contact with the pan is facing up. (Note 6) Spread 1cm/1/3" thick layer of cream one-third of the way up the pancake, in the shape of a piece of mango. Top with mango.

itemListElement.text: Roll, burrito style (see step photos or video), ending with the seam-side down. Repeat with remaining pancakes.
itemListElement.name: Roll, burrito style (see step photos or video), ending with the seam-side down. Repeat with remaining pancakes.

itemListElement.text: Serve immediately! Mango pancakes wait for no-one (due to the cream).
itemListElement.name: Serve immediately! Mango pancakes wait for no-one (due to the cream).

review.reviewBody:
Hubby came home with two massive bagfuls of mango! I made these last night, and Miss 6, in particular, LOVED them. 

We had some issues around composition (the cream is slightly different in Fiji), so I'll probably turn it into a crepe cake next time to guarantee my ideal crepe/mango/cream ratio in each bite!

Recently made a batch and they were fantastic. Just like at a good Yum Cha restaurant. The week after I got an urge at 10pm, used red food colouring and made a Strawberry and cream filled batch for a late night family snack. They all love Dad just a little bit more now.

These are such a yummy, light desert.  I've made them as per the recipe and, in case anyone was wondering, I've also made a dairy free version using coconut cream instead of milk, and Flora Thickened Plant Cream for the filling - worked a treat and very much appreciated by my friends who can't have dairy.

I made this for friends and they adored it. Unfortunately, I'm not a big fan of mangoes (sadly they taste like rotting peaches to me, not certain why,) what other fruits would you suggest to use in their place?  Thank you.
These are the best and so simple to make - the whole family loves them. We're making them again for Christmas along with Trifle. Thank you Nagi for one of the best desserts ever xxx
I loved this, so easy and delicious.

Wow what a great recipe and so simple. Living in Cairns we pick up fallen mangoes all over the place. Make the recipe extremely cost effective. 
Thanks Nagi. Also for the yum char Cafe we'll be paying it a visit next time we're in Syney.
My 12 year old made this recently. She loves to bake and cook. She did a good job making these crepes. We all love them. Thanks for such a good recipe that even a 12 year old can whip it up!

Omg!
My first time making any type of crepe. 
They were so good, I think I may have seen a tear in my hubbies eye 😂
The crepes are so forgiving. 
Making again tomorrow.  
Thank you Nagi, you’re a genius 💚
Making these again. Forgot to rate first time round. These are even better the second time!
Absolutely fantastic. And I am not even a massive pancake fan. Thank you so much for yet another wonderful recipe!

Made this last night. Used frozen mango instead and they came out superb. I did use less sugar in the cream since I thought there was enough in the batter and the mangoes. So tasty! I would also up the cream to a cup as we just ran out.
